snippet: More than half the 500,000 Syrian refugees in Jordan are under 18. “They can’t see beyond, frankly, the next day,” an aid worker said.
abstract: Nearly one-third of 22 million people in Syria need humanitarian help, as civil war rages into its third year, and 1.4 million have fled their homeland altogether; more than half of 500,000 Syrian refugees in Jordan are under 18 and struggling daily to survive, creating a generation that has little hope for a future.

byline.contributor: Ranya Kadri, Lynsey Addario and Tamir Elterman contributed reporting from Jordan.
